qas.question: In what year did James II die?
Who assumed control of the island after the death of James II?
In what year did Venice formally annex the kingdom of Cyprus?
Which empire frequently raided Cyprus during Venetian rule?
In what year did the Ottomans destroy Limassol?

context: Following the death in <a0_0>1473<a0_0/> of James II, the last Lusignan king, the <a1_0>Republic of Venice<a1_0/> assumed control of the island, while the late king's Venetian widow, Queen Catherine Cornaro, reigned as figurehead. Venice formally annexed the Kingdom of Cyprus in <a2_0>1489<a2_0/>, following the abdication of Catherine. The Venetians fortified Nicosia by building the Venetian Walls, and used it as an important commercial hub. Throughout Venetian rule, the <a3_0>Ottoman Empire<a3_0/> frequently raided Cyprus. In <a4_0>1539<a4_0/> the Ottomans destroyed Limassol and so fearing the worst, the Venetians also fortified Famagusta and Kyrenia.
